posts.name: chrisrin
posts.cooked: We haven’t bought 3DP filament for quite a while. What brands of PLA plus/pro and PETG have you been liking recently?

link_counts.title: Question about good Filaments and Printers
3D printing: Onyx vs. other filaments (PETG, etc.)

posts.name: Gus B
posts.cooked: eSun is pretty good. We have gotten a spool of blue pla+ and a spool of black pla+. Half the time we don’t really need to spray the bed for adhesion it sticks so well. It’s also really rigid when printed. MakerBot filaments are also fine, but eSun is the best we have found so far

posts.name: Troy Dietz
posts.cooked:
Prusament all day everyday. Ya can’t beat anything about it except price, and not by much when you amortize failure costs.

Looks like Markforged is tryna give Prusa a run for their money though. They’ll lose, but it’ll be interesting.

posts.name: Nemo
posts.cooked: We switched to Matterhackers MH build PLA this year. We are probably through 20 rolls or more. It works well. We’ve used a bunch of others including Hatchbox and eSun, and I think this MH stuff is as good for less cost.

posts.name: Nathan Shepherd
posts.cooked: My personal experience is with Hatchbox standard PLA and PETG. I can’t tell you how it stacks up to some of the other popular suggestions since I haven’t used them, but it has treated me well so far.

posts.name: Brian Wagg
posts.cooked:
Similar thoughts here with overture PETG. Tried a couple other brands a couple years ago (don’t remember what brands) and ended up landing and sticking with overture as it’s treated me well.

Heard amazing things about prusament, but a little too pricy for me and my hobbyist needs.
Hatchbox works really well in my experience, but I’ve only bought their standard PLA.

posts.name: Jon Stratis
posts.cooked:
There are a lot of good brands out there these days - more often than not, I find myself being more picky about color than brand!  Some of my favorites:

PLA Pro:  eSun

Silk PLA: Yousu (really nice surface finish)

PLA: Overture / Hatchbox

TPU: NinjaTek (flexible prints!)

posts.name: Jason Grabowski
posts.cooked: Filamatrix. Prints like a breeze, you can get it in bulk and had proven to be very strong/tough.

posts.name: CEF
posts.cooked: eSUN PLA+: never had a problem with the prints, comes in a variety of colors (or, at least did before COVID) Ninjatek Armadillo:  Tough rigid TPU.  We used this for our climber spool this year.

posts.name: Brian Rozmierski
posts.cooked:
PLA: Hatchbox all day long. We used “Jessie” filaments from Printed Solid for awhile when Hatchbox was hard to get. No complaints. TPU: Tried a bit of everything, no real recommendations. PETG: Overture. Good quality and cost is very reasonable (plus Prime shipping is nice).

PC / PCCF and anything else: Prusament. We did some prototyping with PLA and final with PCCF and was very impressed. Not cheap (and shipping from Czech Republic on top of it) but was totally worth it in the end.

posts.name: Art Dutra IV
posts.cooked: I’ve had a lot of great results with both Hatchbox and Overture for PLA+/PLA Pro and PETG, although recently I have started to drift more towards Overture for everything solely because they’ve changed from plastic to cardboard spools, which is easier to genuinely recycle.

posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked: cheapest you can find. We spent about $300 total this year just on filament as we printed our whole shooter mechanism.

posts.name: Robert
posts.cooked: For PLA, my personal favorites are Duramic and Esun PLA+, and hatchbox or overture for regular PLA. I don’t have any personal experience with PETG but i’ve heard great things about overture. Prusament is high quality stuff, but it comes at a cost.

posts.name: tkchan

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: think outside of the box from time to time

posts.custom_user_title: think outside of the box from time to time

posts.name: 829 The Digital Goats Official Curmudgeon.
posts.cooked: Duramic is the bomb for PLA and PETG. I also love Prusament but shipping js expensive.

posts.name: paulonis
posts.cooked: Very happy with ColorFabb nGen PETG.

posts.name: Rich Silberfeld
posts.cooked: Did you, by any chance, try the Purple  or Yellow PETG we donated to FIRST?  GreenGate3D gifted 100 spools and all were acquired by various teams; just don’t know who got them.  If so, what did you think?  Thanks, -Rich/GreenGate3D
